name: Slipping Stream
description: Many 32nd century ships have come to the 24th century via temporal anomaly - and immediately begin experiencing strange phenomena. Kovich approaches the issue with piqued curiosity, but the answers he finds may spell disaster for the galaxy!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Doctor Kovich, any versions of T'Rina, Michael Burnham, Tilly, Discovery Crew, or crew matching a Battle Trait will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Le Guin, U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D, or the Galaxy Class Ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Doctor Kovich, President T'Rina, Michael Burnham, Tilly, or Discovery Crew

featured_crew.name: Bryce
featured_crew.flavor: Being promoted to Lieutenant Commander means an increase in duties for Bryce. Will he find time to kitesurf with his new responsibilities?

action.name: I Used to Kitesurf the Biggest Waves on Manark IV

featured_crew.name: Burnham
featured_crew.flavor: With the U.S.S. Discovery fully equipped with a spore drive, Captain Burnham prepares to jump to a distressed station.

featured_crew.name: Tilly
featured_crew.flavor: As the Discovery finds its new place in the 32nd century, Tilly finds hers in the role of Science Officer aboard the ship.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Bryce
rewards.flavor: Being promoted to Lieutenant Commander means an increase in duties for Bryce. Will he find time to kitesurf with his new responsibilities?

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Hey there Captain, to be honest, we're in a less than comfortable situation here. This is not the welcome home I hoped for."
"Doctor Kovich has Starfleet medical running tests on us. We're among those who came from the most distant points in the future."

"Now, now, I'm not putting you two through anything I haven't put myself through. Your results are quite normal compared to the scans I had performed on the other ships and their crews from our time, including the Le Guin, which has decided to depart of its own accord."
"You do not seem very troubled by the fact that a Federation vessel has left spacedock with no account of who, if anyone, is aboard. We need to recover the Le Guin as swiftly as possible."
"Hey there Captain, to be honest, we're in a less than comfortable situation here. This is not the welcome home I hoped for."
"Doctor Kovich has Starfleet medical running tests on us. We're among those who came from the most distant points in the future."

"Now, now, I'm not putting you two through anything I haven't put myself through. Your results are quite normal compared to the scans I had performed on the other ships and their crews from our time, including the Le Guin, which has decided to depart of its own accord."
"You do not seem very troubled by the fact that a Federation vessel has left spacedock with no account of who, if anyone, is aboard. We need to recover the Le Guin as swiftly as possible."

responses.text: "Entertaining? Is this fun for you, Doctor?"
"Why are you being so stingy with your answers, Doctor?"

screens.text: "Well, that was entertaining. You stopped the Le Guin from her autonomous joyride, at least momentarily. But it seems she gave you the slip in the end. I wonder what it is they're searching for."
"I do not see the humor in it. Perhaps this is some human amusement, though if it is, it certainly does not speak highly of your species."
"We've tossed around plenty of ideas, from petty theft to future technology meshing with the present, but nothing seems like a perfect fit."
"Stingy is a harsh term. I prefer 'selective'. Have patience, Captain. I have one more theory to test."
"Perhaps you'd like to take another shot at capturing the Le Guin. If you can manage that, I might have more answers for you."
